You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Canonical URLs for Storefront Pages

Storefront users can arrive at a particular page by following links that use several parameters, such as locale, query data, and session data. Multiple combinations of parameters can resolve to the same page. For human users, this practice doesn’t affect their storefront experience. However, search engine bots evaluate each combination of parameters as a different URL, and index each URL separately. As a result, search engines can create duplicate index entries of a particular page, which dilutes your storefront’s SEO ranking. To combat index duplication, B2B Commerce for Visualforce can insert a canonical URL in the <head> of certain pages. A canonical URL tells search engine bots the authoritative path of a page, which prevents bots from redundant indexing and boosts your SEO ranking.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)

For example, the following URL points to the storefront’s Home page:

https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/ccrz__HomePage

When a buyer visits the page, B2B Commerce for Visualforce appends the locale parameter to the end of the URL, as follows:

https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/ccrz__HomePage?cclcl=en_US

Both URLs resolve to the same page. For a buyer, this difference is negligible. However, specifying one of these URLs as the canonical URL has the following benefits:

Search engines know which URL to index and rank against.
Search engines avoid indexing other URLs that resolve to the same page.
You have a definitive path to the page that you want users to access most often, which is useful when analyzing your storefront traffic.

The version of B2B Commerce for Visualforce that you're using determines how canonical URLs are inserted:

In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later, enable a storefront configuration setting.
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) or earlier, B2B Commerce inserts canonical URLs automatically.
Home Page
B2B COMMERCE FOR VISUALFORCE VERSION	CANONICAL URL VALUE
Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later	

Storefront root URL, excluding the Home page path and all parameters except the guest user's locale:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/StorefrontName/?cclcl=en_US" />

Spring ’19 (version 4.10) or earlier	

Base URL, stripped of all parameters:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/StorefrontName/ccrz__HomePage" />
Product List Page
B2B Commerce for Visualforce inserts a canonical URL only for a Product List page showing category results, and not for a Product List page showing search results. External search services don’t evaluate search queries within your storefront.
NOTE Both version 2.0 and 1.0 of the Product List page support canonical URLs for category results.
B2B COMMERCE FOR VISUALFORCE VERSION	USING FRIENDLY URLS?	CANONICAL URL VALUE
Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later	No	

Base URL, stripped of all parameters except the selected category ID and storefront guest user's locale:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/ccrz__ProductList?categoryId=a0Kf4000006Mc9ZEAS&cclcl=en_US" />

Yes	

Base URL using the selected category's SEO ID value, stripped of all parameters except the storefront guest user's locale:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/Accessories?cclcl=en_US" />

Spring ’19 (version 4.10) or earlier	No	

Base URL, stripped of all parameters except the selected category ID:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/ccrz__ProductList?categoryId=a0Kf4000006Mc9ZEAS" />

Yes	

Base URL using the selected category's SEO ID value, stripped of all parameters:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/Accessories" />
Product Detail Page
B2B COMMERCE FOR VISUALFORCE VERSION	USING FRIENDLY URLS?	CANONICAL URL VALUE
Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later	No	

Base URL, stripped of all parameters except the selected product SKU and the storefront guest user's locale:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/ccrz__ProductDetails?sku=mySKU&cclcl=en_US" />

Yes	

Base URL using the selected product's SEO ID value and canonical category, stripped of all parameters except the storefront guest user's locale:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/Espresso/EastonMachine?cclcl=en_US" />

If a product isn't assigned to a category, the canonical URL excludes the canonical category:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/EastonMachine?cclcl=en_US" />

Spring ’19 (version 4.10) or earlier	No	

Base URL, stripped of all parameters except the selected product SKU:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/ccrz__ProductDetails?sku=mySKU" />

Yes	

Base URL using the selected product's SEO ID value and canonical category, stripped of all parameters:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/Espresso/EastonMachine" />

If a product isn't assigned to a category, the canonical URL excludes the canonical category:

<link rel="canonical" href="https://www.mydomain.com/DefaultStore/EastonMachine" />

title: Canonical URLs for Salesforce B2B Commerce
